content.full_text:
Amendment to “A Bill to Repeal Certain Laws relative to the Permanent Location of
               the Seat of Government of the State of Illinois, Approved February 25 and March 3,
               1837, and for Other Purposes,” [19 July 1837]1 TheGeneral Assemblyof thereserves the right to repeal this act at any time hereafter
paragraphs:
Amendment to “A Bill to Repeal Certain Laws relative to the Permanent Location of
               the Seat of Government of the State of Illinois, Approved February 25 and March 3,
               1837, and for Other Purposes,” [19 July 1837]1
TheGeneral Assemblyof thereserves the right to repeal this act at any time hereafter
citations: Illinois HouseJournal. 1837. 10th G. A., special sess., 119.

footnotes.text:
1A select committee that included Abraham Lincoln presented this amendment in his handwriting
                  toHB 11in the House of Representatives on July 19, 1837. The House approved the amendment
                  on the same day.Illinois HouseJournal. 1837. 10th G. A., special sess., 119.
